text.tspan: There are now more than everbefore resources to
learn both the techincal and therhetical aspects of
music production.
Does not want to spend too much
money either due to guilt over wasteful
spending, or lack of funds.
Getting started with music production
would make them cooler, give creative
outlets.
Busy with school or work, so
they do not want to spend all day trying
to learn enouph to pick-up a hobby.
Satisfaction of creating cool music as an artisitic
expression.
Doesn't like the idea of spending tonnes of money
on a hobby they are not 100% sure they will enjoy --
does not want to overpay.
Feels that a beginner peice of audio-kit may become too
simple and not powerful enouph as they progress in skill level.
Keep the product low cost to make it less of
and investment. Users can buy it without dropping
a large sum of cash.
Have MIDI support enabled, so that as a user grows
they can use the drum machine as a MIDI sequencer
for digital audio workstations -- extends the life of
our product
Provide a simple and low-cost drum machine at
a market price of below $100 CAD.
High level of support -- provide high quality
user manuals and video tutorials showing how
to use our drum machine
Increase the flexability of our product by using samples
rather than analouge synthesis. Makes it so the user has
a wider variety of drum options to choose from so they
can make a variety of sounds.
Provide good documentation for beginners to learn
how to use our product.
Keep the interface simple -- anybody should be able
to pick up our product and start making music in only
a few minutes. This makes it so that users get the imme-
diate feeling of progression.
Value Proposition Canvas
May find using a drummachine hard or confusing.
Make the user experience of our device simple and approachable.
Gains
Pains
Customer Jobs
Gain creators
Pain relievers
Products &
Services
